beethoven.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
beethoven.description: Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer who was one of the most powerful and emotional composers in history. He loved creating music that sounded like storms, celebrations, and huge adventures. Even though he started losing his hearing when he was still a young man, Beethoven refused to give up. He kept composing by feeling the vibrations of the piano and imagining the sounds in his mind. His music, like the famous ‚ÄúFifth Symphony‚Äù and ‚ÄúF√ºr Elise,‚Äù is still played everywhere, and people of all ages love the strong feelings his melodies bring.
beethoven.fun_fact: Beethoven was known for having very wild hair and sometimes forgetting to fix it - people in Vienna often recognized him on the street because of his messy hairstyle!

bach.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
bach.description: Johann Sebastian Bach was a German composer who was one of the greatest musical builders ever. He created music with amazing patterns, layers, and harmonies that fit together like a perfect puzzle. Bach worked very hard, teaching, composing, and playing the organ nearly every day. His music, like the Brandenburg Concertos and Well-Tempered Clavier, is admired for its beauty and structure by musicians all around the world.
bach.fun_fact: Bach had 20 children, and several of them also became composers!

mozart.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
mozart.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was an Austrian composer who was a musical genius who started composing when he was only five years old! He traveled around Europe with his family, performing for kings and queens. Mozart‚Äôs music is full of sparkle, energy, and clever ideas, and he loved making people smile with his melodies. Even though he lived only 35 years, he wrote more than 600 pieces that musicians still play everywhere today.
mozart.fun_fact: Mozart could hear a piece of music once and then write it down perfectly from memory!

brahms.name: Johannes Brahms
brahms.description: Johannes Brahms wrote music that sounded both powerful and comforting, like big waves mixed with warm hugs. He admired Bach and Beethoven and worked hard to continue their tradition while adding his own rich, emotional style. Brahms was very kind, loved books, and spent many quiet evenings reading or composing. His music, including his symphonies and lullabies, is still treasured today.
brahms.fun_fact: Brahms wrote one of the most famous lullabies ever - the ‚ÄúBrahms‚Äô Lullaby‚Äù that parents still sing to babies today.

schubert.name: Franz Schubert
schubert.description: Franz Schubert had a gift for writing melodies that sound warm, sweet, and full of emotion. He loved composing songs - he wrote over 600 of them! People admired how beautifully he could express feelings through music. Although he was shy, Schubert was surrounded by friends who believed in him and held special gatherings called ‚ÄúSchubertiades‚Äù where they played his music together.
schubert.fun_fact: Schubert wrote some of his most famous music in tiny notebooks he carried everywhere - even while walking!

chopin.name: Frederic Chopin
chopin.description: Fr√©d√©ric Chopin was a Polish composer who was the master of piano music. Almost everything he wrote was for the piano, and his pieces are full of emotion, poetry, and beautiful melodies. He could make the piano sound like whispering winds, dancing steps, or a gentle lullaby. Chopin preferred performing in small rooms rather than big halls because he liked making music that felt personal and delicate.
chopin.fun_fact: Chopin was so talented that other musicians said he made the piano ‚Äúsing like a human voice.‚Äù

schumann.name: Robert Schumann
schumann.description: Robert Schumann was a German composer who loved to write songs and music. He was friends with a group of composers who were enemies and wrote amazing music that was enemies.

handel.name: George Frideric Handel
handel.description: Handel was a famous composer who lived more than 300 years ago, and he loved writing music that made people feel powerful and excited. Even though he moved from Germany to England, he became one of Britain‚Äôs favorite musicians. Handel was known for working super fast - he wrote his most famous piece, Messiah, in only a few weeks! People loved his music so much that even kings came to hear it. Today, his melodies are still played all over the world, especially the joyful ‚ÄúHallelujah‚Äù chorus that makes everyone want to stand up and sing along. If you listen closely, you can almost hear the energy and fun he put into every note!
handel.fun_fact: Handel wrote the entire "Messiah" in an incredibly short time - only about 24 days!

vivaldi.name: Antonio Vivaldi
vivaldi.description: Antonio Vivaldi was an Italian composer who loved to write songs and music. He was friends with a group of composers who were enemies and wrote amazing music that was enemies.

iosTip.title: Use landscape on iPad
iosTip.body: For the best PianoMaster experience on iPad, rotate your device to landscape and use the installed app from your Home Screen.
iosTip.installInstructions: Install the app by tapping the Share button in Safari and choosing Add to Home Screen, then open PianoMaster from the new icon.
